reviews.review: Um jogo único! Com puzzles criativos e difíceis em certos momentos, diálogos engraçados entre Glados e Wheatley, jogabilidade simples e que responde bem e um coop ótimo para se divertir com seus amigos. Basicamente... Magnifico. Espero ter ajudado.

Excelente história, grande jogabilidade, horas de diversão onde você realmente deve pensar para resolver os quebra-cabeças e não só apertar uma sequência de teclas. Como se resumi tudo isso em poucas palavras, acredito que a melhor expressão seria “uma bela obra de arte esculpida pela Valve”.
Great puzzle game, incredibly fun and completley different when played with a friend.
Simplesmente uma obra-prima!
Рекомендую, довольно интересная игра.

This is by far one of the best games you will ever play. The puzzles and humour that defined the first Portal have been taken even further to create a hilarious and challenging game that looks, sounds, and plays great. There's plenty of replay value and I've personally run through the game a few times. The co-op campaign is just as well done as single player and isn't a bolted on afterthought commonly found with other games. There are also challenge levels for those who enjoy that though I'm not a huge fan.

Overall, a near flawless game which is just as hilarious and fun each time you play it through.

Наука движется далеко вперёд, и мы идём вместе с ней, несмотря на то, что многие из нас уже давно мертвы. Это я так к слову. 

И всё же, добро пожаловать в лабораторию корпорации "Aperture Science"! Здесь мы предлагаем Вам самую прекрасную и престижную работу в сфере научных изысканий. 

Огромный (воистину огромный, о Боже!) комплекс лабораторий нашей корпорации  является воплощением технологического прогресса и научного прорыва. Вам представлена прекрасная возможность проявиться в качестве испытателя-экспериментатора! К Вашему вниманию - сеть комфортных лабораторий для испытания в стерильных условиях новейших гелей и энергетических полей, исследования природы порталов, обоснование законов физики и гравитации, и да - применение совершенных усилителей для ног (пожалуй, величайшее творение нашего великого учёного, господина Джонсона!) и исследование психологии восприятия... кубов! Приятные впечатления от испытаний, а также тёплый приём наших коллег не оставит Вас равнодушными!

А если Вам этого будет мало - шикарная экскурсия по старым заброшенным лабораториям комплекса "Aperture", а также демонстрация новейших андроидов-испытателей и автоматических турелей нового поколения. Пожалуй, за это нам стоило бы взымать отдельную плату. И всё же, добро пожаловать к нам! Здесь мы рады всем... живым. С уважением, сотрудник "Aperture Science".

The sequel to the AMAZING game known as Portal. This game takes everything from Portal 1 and turns up the awesome factor. I can sit here all day and be a fanboy but I must suggest (as always) if your in for the story TO PLAY the first one to give an idea.


- Co-op. I cannot tell how much enjoyment me and my bud had when first playing the co-op. It's a bit short and leaves you wanting more. That's where the workshop and mods come in. 

And the fun of bullshiting around while you and your bud try to come up with the answer to said puzzle.

- Workshop works well for this game. Although, It's only for shorter maps made with a simplified version of the SDK. It's still a blast to look at!

If your honestly a Valve fan or just want something with a twist and new, you need to pick this up.
the tests are back! environments look incredible, great dialogue especially wheatley, oh man, had me laughing a lot 10/10 must buy especially on the sale for only $5, what a steal!

One of the best games ever. Of all time. The Story and puzzling nature of single player mixed with the insanity and fun of Co-op make this one of my favorite games ever.

This game is what happens when you take something good and tumblrfy it.

.The puzzles are dumbed down for a more casual audience - most of the time, you will be looking for the only spot you can shoot a portal on, especially towards the end. The aerial faith plates and lazers are just old gameplay elements given a new skin, momentum and energy pellets, respectively, and the other, more innovative gameplay elements, the gels, hard light bridge and excursion funnels, are never fully implemented before being tossed aside.
.The jokes have been reduced to three, constantly repeated categories: blunt insults, irony and shouty reactions. It's not an issue of sensitivity, but when the joke is just "You're fat" over and over again, it loses its value. 
.Given a completely unnecessary backstory, from Caroline to every single one of Cave Johnson's messsages. Not only do they ruin the character of GLaDOS by giving her a sappy backstory that no one asked for, but they devalue the credibility and seriousness of Aperture Science through Cave Johnson's inconsistent, outlandish antics. It's no secret that they were just done for a cheap laugh, though.

The combination of the previous two points means that Portal 2 loses the subtlety of the original. What was once the humorous dark environment of the original game has been reduced to a so quirky exdee floating British accent and cheap insult after cheap insult with no sustenance, what was the eerie writings of an ecapee on the walls warning you about the madness to come should you keep following the voice guiding you has become the ramblings of a complete idiot that would never have had any kind of funding to begin with, and what was once a mysterious robot who you only knew as the thing out for your death became some petty love interest to the same man, creating a back story that no one wanted or asked for. Not only was this unnecessary, but poorly implemented. We're introduced to Caroline so late into the game, and she appears so rarely into the game that we're barely given any chance to grow attatched to her as a charcter. Caroline is only given one setting: slightly ditzy. We don't even hear any growth between Cave and Caroline, we're only given the information that Cave has feelings for her.  It's also just a bad backstory. 
I am by no way suggesting that Portal 1 was some kind of modern gaming masterpiece with excellent storytelling and jokes, but it did what it did beautifully, and Portal 2 threw it all out of the window for a new, more casual audience.

Generally a great game. Lacks the violent action that some people may be looking for, but the problem-solving and story aspects are absolutely amazing. Character design is quite interesting, with the Personality Constructs (otherwise known as cores) being one of the most expressive robots I've ever seen. 
As for the storyline, it's arguably best to have played the original Portal, if only to know why you're recognized by the Central Core. Otherwise you can easily figure out what happened previously based on what the AI tells you. 
Portal 2 includes a co-op mode for two players, and is more focused on solving tests than following a story. Quite entertaining to try to complete. Along with that, Workshop integration is also available, allowing players to build tests from scratch. If the PeTI ends up being too limited for creators, they can try to use Hammer and other authoring tools.
The soundtrack can be downloaded for free, and is quite a good source of background music, at least for me.
